qas.question: What is the principal alternative to electric railways?
What locomotives are usually more reliable?
What do some electric traction systems provide?
What type of fuel do diesel locomotives use?
What is one of the sources electricity is being generated from?
What does not offer better emissions efficiency?
Electricity is generated from many sources that do produce carbon what?
electricity is generated from non-renewable forms including?
Which locomotives have no global emissions?
All electric traction systems provide what kind of braking?

context: In comparison to the principal alternative, the <a0_0>diesel engine<a0_0/>, <b5_0>electric railways<b5_0/> offer substantially better energy efficiency, lower emissions and lower operating costs. <a1_0><b8_0>Electric<b8_0/> locomotives<a1_0/> are usually quieter, more powerful, and more responsive and reliable than diesels. They have no local emissions, an important advantage in tunnels and urban areas. Some electric traction systems provide <a2_0><b9_0>regenerative<b9_0/> braking<a2_0/> that turns the train's kinetic energy back into electricity and returns it to the supply system to be used by other trains or the general utility grid. While diesel locomotives burn <a3_0>petroleum<a3_0/>, electricity is generated from diverse sources including many that do not produce carbon <b6_0>dioxide<b6_0/> such as nuclear power and renewable forms including <b7_0>hydroelectric, <a4_0>geothermal<a4_0/>, wind and solar<b7_0/>.
